name: Apple M3 chip
description: M3 brings serious speed and capability to blaze through everyday activities, multitask across apps and video calls, and handle elaborate content in pro apps and games
details: Run multiple apps, speed through thousands of photos
Configure with up to 24GB unified memory

name: Apple M3 Pro chip
description: Building on the M3 chip, M3 Pro provides even greater performance and additional unified memory for more demanding apps and workflows
details: Manipulate gigapixel panoramas, compile millions of lines of code
Configure with up to 36GB unified memory
Supports up to two external displays

name: Apple M3 Max chip
description: M3 Max powers the most extreme workflows with even more CPU and GPU cores, enormous unified memory and an advanced Media Engine
details: Render intricate 3D content, develop transformer models with billions of parameters
Tackle post-production of 8K video and beyond
Configure with up to 128GB unified memory
Supports up to four external displays

name: Unified Memory
description: Faster and more efficient than traditional RAM, unified memory is integrated within the M3 family of chips so apps can quickly share data between the CPU, GPU and Neural Engine
details: Run multiple apps at once while performance remains fast and responsive
Add memory to run more apps simultaneously for faster, more fluid multitasking
With M3 Max, MacBook Pro can be configured with up to 128GB of memory
